subject: Design

title: Paul Rand: The Father of Modern Logo Design
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Paul Rand: The Father of Modern Logo Design.

hook.text: One man designed the logos for IBM, ABC, UPS, and NeXT. His name was Paul Rand.

buildup.text: Rand believed a logo doesn't need to describe what a company does. It needs to be memorable.

discovery.text: His IBM logo ‚Äî horizontal stripes through block letters ‚Äî turned a boring name into an icon.

twist.text: Steve Jobs paid Rand $100,000 for the NeXT logo. Rand gave him one option and said, 'This is it.'

climax.text: Rand proved that great logo design is about confidence, not options.

punchline.text: The best designer gives you one answer, not twenty.

quiz.question: What was Paul Rand's philosophy about logo design?
options: A logo needs to be memorable, not descriptive
